description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Scarcity â€” The Fear of Missing Out.

hook.text: When Concorde flights were canceled, ticket sales surged. The same flight became desirable only when it was disappearing.

buildup.text: Scarcity makes things seem more valuable. Limited time, limited quantity, and exclusive access all trigger urgency.

discovery.text: Loss aversion means people fear losing something twice as much as they enjoy gaining it.

twist.text: Artificial scarcity is everywhere â€” 'Only 3 left!' messages are often generated regardless of actual stock.

climax.text: In negotiations, highlighting what the other side stands to lose is more powerful than what they gain.

punchline.text: People don't want what's available. They want what's about to disappear.

quiz.question: Why does scarcity increase perceived value?
options: Scarce things are always better quality
Loss aversion makes people fear missing out more than they enjoy gaining
